body_html:
In TF 1.2, we removed the Keras TruncatedNormal initializer and instead simply imported the core version (from init_ops). The core version has a different default stddev value, hence the change. This was an oversight.

Code in contrib is subject to changes. Now the Keras API has moved to core, so such changes will not happen in the future.

In general, I would recommend not using TruncatedNormal (prefer scaling initializers such as glorot, etc) and I would recommend always specifying stddev if you are using it.

body:
In TF 1.2, we removed the Keras `TruncatedNormal` initializer and instead simply imported the core version (from `init_ops`). The core version has a different default `stddev` value, hence the change. This was an oversight.

Code in contrib is subject to changes. Now the Keras API has moved to core, so such changes will not happen in the future.

In general, I would recommend not using `TruncatedNormal` (prefer scaling initializers such as glorot, etc) and I would recommend always specifying `stddev` if you are using it.
